title: Famous Battles Recall
description: Match historic battles to their wars, locations, and outcomes

questions.question: The Battle of Gettysburg, a turning point in the American Civil War, took place in which year?
Which 1815 battle marked Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat?
The Battle of Hastings in 1066 was fought between the Normans and which people?
D-Day, the massive Allied invasion of Normandy, took place on which date?
The Battle of Thermopylae in 480 BC is famous for the stand of 300 warriors from which Greek city-state?
Which World War I battle, lasting from July to November 1916, was one of the bloodiest in history?
The Battle of Stalingrad (1942-1943) was a decisive turning point in which war?
At which 1805 naval battle did Admiral Horatio Nelson defeat the combined French and Spanish fleets?
The Battle of Midway in 1942, a turning point in the Pacific Theater, was primarily fought between which two navies?
Which 1776 battle saw George Washington famously cross the Delaware River on Christmas night?
The Battle of Agincourt in 1415, where English longbowmen triumphed, was part of which war?
Which ancient battle in 331 BC saw Alexander the Great decisively defeat the Persian King Darius III?
The Battle of the Bulge, the last major German offensive on the Western Front, began in which month and year?
Which 1836 battle at a former mission in Texas became a rallying cry for Texan independence?
The Battle of Marathon in 490 BC was fought between the Greeks and which empire?
